rules.natural: If Alice submits Paper1, then Paper1 is published.
Provided that Alice revises Paper1, if Paper1 is not published, then Paper1 is withdrawn.
Alice revises Paper1 or Bob revises Paper1.
In case Bob revises Paper1, whenever Paper1 is not published, Paper1 is withdrawn.
Publication of Paper1 is scheduled, or if it is not the case that acceptance of Paper1 leads to publication, then Paper1 is rejected.
PublisherY approves Paper1 or PublisherY rejects Paper1.
Given that PublisherY rejects Paper1, then in the event that neither copyright is agreed upon nor Paper1 is published, publication of Paper1 is delayed.
If Bob submits Paper1, then Paper1 is published.
Funding for Paper1 is secured, or if PublisherY approves Paper1, then provided that neither copyright is agreed upon nor Paper1 is published, publication of Paper1 is delayed.
Either the open access fee for Paper1 is paid or funding for Paper1 is not secured.
Whenever copyediting of Paper1 is complete, Paper1 is published.
Copyediting of Paper1 is complete or typesetting of Paper1 is complete.
Provided that JournalX assigns Evan as a proofreader for Paper1, galley proofs for Paper1 are ready.
Either JournalX assigns Evan as a proofreader for Paper1 or JournalX assigns Fiona as a proofreader for Paper1.
Assuming JournalX assigns Fiona as a proofreader for Paper1, then if it is not the case that typesetting completion leads to publication, formatting issues do not exist in Paper1.
Whenever a review from Charlie is received for Paper1, JournalX evaluates Charlie's review for Paper1.
Provided that JournalX evaluates Charlie's review for Paper1, a decision is made by JournalX regarding Paper1.
If JournalX assigns Charlie as a reviewer for Paper1, then a review from Charlie is received for Paper1.
Either JournalX assigns Charlie as a reviewer for Paper1 or JournalX assigns Dana as a reviewer for Paper1.
Given that a decision is made by JournalX regarding Paper1, then Alice submits Paper1 or Bob submits Paper1.
Whenever a plagiarism check is performed on Paper1, a similarity report is generated for Paper1.
A plagiarism check is performed on Paper1, or if Paper1 is not published, then Paper1 is withdrawn.
Provided that the ethics committee approves Paper1, then if a similarity report is generated, a citation check is performed.
Either PublisherY approves the layout of Paper1 or PublisherY rejects the layout of Paper1.
Assuming PublisherY rejects the layout of Paper1, then whenever it is not the case that acceptance leads to publication, Paper1 is rejected.
Printing of Paper1 is scheduled, or if PublisherY approves the layout of Paper1, then provided that it is not the case that acceptance leads to publication, Paper1 is rejected.
Publication of Paper1 is canceled, or in the event that a copyright dispute arises, publication is delayed.
Given that JournalX assigns Dana as a reviewer for Paper1, then either Alice submits Paper1 or Bob submits Paper1.
Whenever a DOI is assigned to Paper1, metadata for Paper1 is registered.
Provided that metadata for Paper1 is registered, publication of Paper1 is not canceled.
Should JournalX give final approval for Paper1, then galley proofs for Paper1 are ready, or if it is not the case that typesetting completion leads to publication, formatting issues do not exist.

Assuming JournalX gives final rejection for Paper1, then galley proofs for Paper1 are ready, or whenever it is not the case that typesetting completion leads to publication, formatting issues do not exist.
If the chief editor of JournalX reviews Paper1, JournalX gives final approval for Paper1.
Either the chief editor of JournalX reviews Paper1 or the managing editor of JournalX reviews Paper1.
In case the editorial board of JournalX meets, then if the managing editor reviews Paper1, final rejection is given.
Should an external consultant be hired by JournalX for Paper1, then assuming the managing editor reviews Paper1, final rejection is given.
Whenever the publication committee approves Paper1, then either the editorial board meets or an external consultant is hired.
Either the publication committee approves Paper1 or the publication committee rejects Paper1.
Given that the publication committee rejects Paper1, then the editorial board meets or an external consultant is hired.
If Charlie completes the review of Paper1, then either Alice submits Paper1 or Bob submits Paper1.
Provided that JournalX's editor approves Charlie, then if JournalX assigns Charlie as a reviewer, Charlie completes the review.
Either JournalX's editor approves Charlie or JournalX's editor rejects Charlie.

rules.prover9_expression: (review_request_sent(JournalX, Charlie, Paper1) -> (reviewer_assigns(JournalX, Charlie, Paper1) -> review_complete(Charlie, Paper1)))
rules.natural: If JournalX sends a review request to Charlie for Paper1, then provided that JournalX assigns Charlie as a reviewer, Charlie completes the review.
Should it not be the case that acceptance leads to publication, then Paper1 is not rejected.
Provided that neither copyright is agreed upon nor Paper1 is published, a copyright dispute arises.
Assuming neither copyright is agreed upon nor Paper1 is published, publication of Paper1 is not delayed.
If it is not the case that typesetting completion leads to publication, formatting issues exist in Paper1.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(editor_rejects(JournalX, Charlie) -> review_request_sent(JournalX, Charlie, Paper1)) -> alternative_reviewer_assigned(JournalX, Paper1))
rules.natural: Should it not be the case that editor rejection leads to a review request being sent, an alternative reviewer is assigned.
Provided that it is not the case that editor rejection leads to a review request being sent, an alternative reviewer is not assigned.
Whenever Paper1 is not published, Paper1 is not withdrawn.
